intro: Tacsonia coccinea, commonly known as the red-tipped plant or red-tipped pelargonium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its striking red-tipped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and container planting.
